DataElement.preferredName: Blood Transfusion Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Applicable Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions addressing administration of components of blood into the blood stream as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Transfusion Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The administration of blood or blood products into a blood vessel.

Concepts.definition: The injection of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received packed r
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received packed red blood cell or platelet transfusion within 28 days prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has low blood count and requires transfusion support, are they due to the MDS/AML?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive blood transfusion within 28 days prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any transfusions with red blood cells or platelets within 1 week prior to screening assessment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had platelet transfusion within 7 days prior to study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had platelet transfusion within 7 days prior to treatment start or myeloid growth factors within 14 days prior to treatment start?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a red blood cell transfusion within 3 weeks before the start of the trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have red blood cell (RBC) transfusion dependence, defined as requiring more than 2 units of RBCs transfused during the 4-week period prior to screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a blood transfusion within two weeks before collection of blood for central ctDNA testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received transfusion of blood products (including platelets or red blood cells) or administration of colony stimulating factors (including granulocyte colony-stimulating factor [G-CSF], granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor [GM-CSF], or recombinant erythropoietin) within 4 weeks prior to initiating the study drug BAY 1895344?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received transfusion of blood products (including platelets or red blood cells) or administration of colony stimulating factors (including granulocyte colony-stimulating factor [G-CSF], granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor [GM-CSF], or recombinant erythropoietin) within 4 weeks prior to registration?
